author: redbeardlegoman
title: Science Please Penguin
review:
One of my favourite things that TLG is doing more actively in recent years, is putting female minifigs into traditionally male roles.

I love that my daughter gets to see that kind of positive reinforcement of the idea that she should follow her dreams whatever they may be.  Getting that message out to children early may be one of the ways we redeem our species.

So I find it very nice to see a woman working as a wildlife photographer in the antarctic.

I also find it pleasing for two other biographical reasons.

1)  I once applied for a job working at McMurdo base as a cook.  I didn't get it, and went to Japan instead.  Which turned out just as well, because my wife and daughter are Japanese.

2) I'm a life-long photographer, and would certainly have been taking photos of penguins at every opportunity.  Now, I can make my sig-fig do exactly that.

And that's because in yet another delightful addition to the Lego Zoo, we have a penguin!

I love the brick built penguins that usually come with Batman v The Penguin sets, but I would be a filthy liar if I said I didn't also adore this molded penguin.

However, the pure icing on this cake of utter awesome is that I firmly believe that it was inspired by Science Please Penguin.

If you don't know Science Please Penguin, do yourself a favour and Google that right now.  You'll be so glad you did.

author: Odeinoichus
title: Another Great New Animal
review:
Set #71013 Wildlife Photographer: Here comes a great Minifigure and a great new animal piece, the first of its kind and different from the LEGO Friends version of the creature.

This photographer would fit in well with LEGO City Arctic, she's got a dark red and blue winter outfit with dual-molded printing for the legs, the arms and a double-sided torso print for her jacket details. She's wearing the new fur-covered hood piece and has a nice dual-sided facial print, one side with a smile and wearing protective goggles the other winking, or perhaps peeking through the viewfinder with one eye closed as some professionals are known to work.

The penguin is a great accessory, he's a brand new piece with a stud on the back to attach things to and excellent looking detail work. She also includes a camera, and is often the case, a single hollow stud is used to add depth to the lens of the camera.

I strongly recommend getting multiples of this one if you can find anymore, I wish I'd at least gotten two for that neat new animal piece, but I'm sure we'll see it again now that it's been introduced. Overall a great minifigure from Series 16.
